intro: Coryphadenia monantha var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered coryphadenia, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant purple to violet bracts that surround its small, tubular flowers. Native to specific regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage is typically dark green with a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its aesthetic and scientific value.
